business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks offset IT gains in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 125.67 points to 81,518.72, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.50 points to 24,946.15 as of 9:33 am.

Game over for money-based online gaming? Industry in shock over proposed banIf passed in Parliament, the bill will outlaw all money-based online games (irrespective of whether they involve skill or chance), ban advertisements promoting such platforms, and bar banks and financial institutions from processing related transactions.

Death knell for industry: Gaming body writes to Amit Shah on money-based gaming banIn its communication, the All India Gaming Federation stressed the need for "progressive regulation" rather than outright prohibition, highlighting the potential fallout for millions of players and the broader industry.

Centre to ban all money-based gaming transactions under new bill: SourcesUnder the proposed Regulation & Promotion of Online Gaming Act, banks and financial institutions will not be allowed to process or transfer funds for real-money online games.

Sensex, Nifty close higher on GST buzz, easing global tensionsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 370.64 points, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 103.70 points to settle at 24,980.65. Broader markets also ended in the green, with mid- and small-cap stocks outperforming.

PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana: Who can get Rs 15,000 and other benefitsFirst-time employees under Part A can receive a one-time incentive equal to about one month's basic pay, up to Rs 15,000, paid in two instalments.

Two retirees, Rs 2 crore each, yet one runs out of money early. CA explains whyTwo retirees may have the same Rs 2 crore in savings, but their financial journeys can differ drastically. A CA explains how market timing and sequencing risk can decide who runs out of money first.

Are next-gen GST reforms a done deal?The next-gen GST overhaul could redefine India's tax landscape, but consensus among states and revenue concerns will decide its fate. For now, GST 2.0 is a promise, not a done deal. Read to know why.

ITR-U explained: Check eligibility, deadline, and penalties for updated returnsThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has made it simpler for taxpayers to correct errors in their income tax returns through the updated ITR-U. Here's a guide on who can file, the deadline, and possible penalties.

Why you should wait until October for big purchases, explains expertIf you've been planning to buy a car, air conditioner, or other expensive items, it might be wise to hold off for a few weeks. Expert says waiting until October could save you money thanks to upcoming GST reforms.

Why lower GST is better for your wallet than income tax reliefUnlike income tax, which applies only to those earning above a certain threshold, GST is an indirect tax levied on almost every transaction, covering nearly everything you buy.
How the SCL fire in Mohali sabotaged India's chip dreamsThe blaze caused losses estimated at Rs 75 crore in 1989, but the true cost the nation would pay would be known decades later.

entertainment.headline: Hari Hara Veera Mallu on OTT: Pawan Kalyan period drama to stream on Prime VideoPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' makes a swift transition to OTT after a lukewarm theatrical release. It will soon premiere on Prime Video.

Prabhas's pic from director Hanu's film leaked, makers remove posts, warn actionPrabhas' photo from the upcoming film 'Fauji' leaked, leading to legal warnings from the producers. The film, tentatively titled 'Fauji', is being directed by Hanu Raghavapudi.

Boney Kapoor on No Entry 2: Regret not retaining Salman Khan, Anil, and FardeenFilmmaker Boney Kapoor shared that he waited for Salman Khan, Anil Kapoor, and Fardeen Khan for nearly 8 to 10 years to move ahead with the sequel to 'No Entry'.

AR Murugadoss says SRK liked Madharasi pitch before SivakarthikeyanAcclaimed director AR Murugadoss revealed that his upcoming Tamil film 'Madharasi' starring Sivakarthikeyan was once pitched to Shah Rukh Khan for a Bollywood version but never took off. Sivakarthikeyan's version of the film will hit theatres on September 5.

Anurag Kashyap blasts AI-film Chiranjeevi Hanuman producer: Future for spinelessAnurag Kashyap criticised the backing of an AI-generated film 'Chiranjeevi Hanuman' by Vijay Subramaniam, prompting discussions on AI's role in filmmaking.

Inappropriate attack: Justin Baldoni slams Isabela Ferrer's harassment claimsThe subpoena dispute between Justin Baldoni and Isabela Ferrer escalated with allegations of misconduct and legal manoeuvring, as Ferrer's counsel challenged Baldoni's actions.

The Diplomat Season 3 release date out: New teaser introduces a flawed PresidentThe new teaser of 'The Diplomat Season 3' has been released along with the date announcement. Global diplomacy and foreign negotiations get tougher this time, led by a flawed President in the White House.

Achyut Potdar dies: Aamir Khan, Boman Irani pay last respects to 3 Idiots co-starActors Aamir Khan and Boman Irani mourned the death of veteran actor Achyut Potdar. They paid their last respects to their '3 Idiots' co-star.

Dhanashree Verma on divorce with Yuzvendra Chahal: I started howling in courtChoreographer Dhanashree Verma shared that she had an emotional breakdown during her divorce proceedings with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal. She also reacted to her ex-husband's controversial T-shirt that said 'Be Your Sugar Daddy.'

Actor Mammootty to resume shoot after taking a break due to health complicationsMalayalam actor Mammootty, who had recently faced some health complications, has recovered completely and will be joining the sets of his upcoming film with Mahesh Narayanan.

Shruti Haasan says South stars are more humble, God-fearing, compared to BollywoodShruti Haasan discusses the cultural and psychological differences between South Indian cinema and Bollywood. She reflects on how humility and spirituality shape her approach to acting and her career choices.

Bosco Martis on SRK's National Award win: Bollywood without him would not be sameChoreographer Bosco Martis reflected on Shah Rukh Khan's National Award win. In an exclusive interaction with India Today, he stated how the industry will never be the same without him.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija reacts to ex-partner's hate songInfluencer Apoorva Mukhija indirectly reacted to the song 'Cute little red flag' by her ex Utsav Dahiya, on Monday, August 18. In the song, Dahiya accused the influencer of lying, cheating, and using their relationship for content.

Deepika Padukone to begin 100-day shoot for Atlee's film - all you need to knowActor Deepika Padukone will commence a 100-day shoot for Atlee's film. The pan-India project would feature Padukone in an action-packed warrior avatar. She is paired opposite actor Allu Arjun in the film.

Thama hidden gems: Moments you might have missed in Ayushmaan-Rashmika's film teaserThe Thama teaser introduces a unique desi vampire romance starring Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna. The film promises a fresh take on horror and is set to release this Diwali.

Malayalam actor Pala Suresh dies of cardiac arrest at 53Suresh Krishna, popularly known as Pala Suresh, reportedly had a heart condition and was undergoing treatment at Kottayam Medical College. He was found in an unresponsive state at his residence and was pronounced dead upon arrival at the hospital.

Exclusive: Salman, Sonali's Prem-Preeti reunion on Bigg Boss 19 - Here's all we knowActor Salman Khan will be joined by his 'Hum Saath-Saath Hain' co-star Sonali Bendre at 'Bigg Boss 19' premiere. Sonali will be present at the show to promote her new reality series 'Pati Patni Aur Panga'.

Explained: Direct Action Day, Noakhali riots at the heart of The Bengal FilesAs Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Bengal Files' sparks debate, a look back at the violence of Direct Action Day and the Noakhali riots that shaped Bengal's partition.

Andhera actor Priya Bapat urges filmmakers not to typecast her in BollywoodActor Priya Bapat, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, spoke about being stereotyped in Bollywood. Proud of her Maharashtrian roots, the actor discussed how she wants to be seen beyond her identity.

general news.headline: Delhi Chief Minister 'slapped' by man at public event, attacker detainedAccording to officials, the accused first handed over the papers to Rekha Gupta, then began shouting and yelling before attacking her. He was immediately overpowered and taken into custody.

Centre to bring bills to remove PM, chief ministers arrested on serious chargesThe government is set to introduce bills regarding the removal of the Prime Minister and chief ministers arrested for 30 days, today in Lok Sabha.

Trump imposed sanctions on India to pressure Russia over Ukraine war: White HouseWhite House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said Trump increased India's tariffs to 50% as part of sanctions designed to pressure Russia to end the Ukraine war.

Rahul Gandhi's 'vote chori' campaign in Bihar hits snag after woman's U-turnRahul Gandhi's voter adhikar yatra in Bihar faced controversy after a family admitted their names were present on the voter list. The incident questions the credibility of voter deletion claims amid the upcoming assembly polls.

Game over for money-based online gaming? Industry in shock over proposed banIf passed in Parliament, the bill will outlaw all money-based online games (irrespective of whether they involve skill or chance), ban advertisements promoting such platforms, and bar banks and financial institutions from processing related transactions.

Live: Red alert issued, civic body says life in city remains normalMumbai rain live updates: A Red Warning has been issued for Mumbai, with the Indian Meteorological Department forecasting moderate to intense spells of rain today. The rains have already left 1 dead and 3 injured in the city. Tune in to intoday.in for the latest updates.

Over 50 schools in Delhi receive bomb threats via email, 2nd incident this weekOver 50 schools in Delhi received bomb threat emails on Wednesday, just two days after 32 schools across the capital were targeted in a similar manner.

Shameful record since 1971: India shreds Pakistan at UN over sexual violenceIndia strongly rebutted Pakistan's allegations of sexual violence in Jammu and Kashmir at the UN. The Indian diplomat highlighted Pakistan's own poor record on crimes against minority women, calling for justice and survivor support.

India's richest families profiteering from Russia oil: Top US official ups attackIn the past 10 days, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has repeatedly targeted India for its energy trade with Russia.

Asia Cup 2025: Shreyas Iyer knocks hard, but T20I doors stay shutShreyas Iyer continues to find himself out of T20I contention despite knocking hard on the selectors' doors with his unprecedented IPL and domestic numbers. As chief selector Ajit Agarkar says that there's no place for Iyer in the T20I team for now, the question remains: what more does he have to do to get back into the reckoning?

Death knell for industry: Gaming body writes to Amit Shah on money-based gaming banIn its communication, the All India Gaming Federation stressed the need for "progressive regulation" rather than outright prohibition, highlighting the potential fallout for millions of players and the broader industry.

Partially burnt body of 20-year-old student found in Karnataka, police suspect rapeThe partially burnt body of a 20-year-old BA student was found in Karnataka's Chitradurga, two days after she went missing. Police suspect rape and murder and have launched a manhunt for the accused.

Dhanashree Verma on divorce with Yuzvendra Chahal: I started howling in courtChoreographer Dhanashree Verma shared that she had an emotional breakdown during her divorce proceedings with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal. She also reacted to her ex-husband's controversial T-shirt that said 'Be Your Sugar Daddy.'

Why pay Rs 150 for bad roads? Top court says no tolls on Kerala highway with potholesThe Supreme Court has stopped toll collection on a pothole-ridden highway in Kerala. The court said citizens cannot be charged extra for poorly maintained roads. Appeals by the National Highways Authority of India and others were dismissed.

Want to try and get to heaven: Trump ties Ukraine peace push to higher callingDuring an interview, Donald Trump, 79, quipped that his path to heaven might hinge on securing the Russia-Ukraine peace deal.
Inspired by crime show CID, Jaipur woman kills husband with lover's helpJaipur Police cracked the case using CCTV and surveillance, arresting the victim's wife, her lover and his friend.

Why Indians are taking their long weekends abroadThis Independence Day long weekend, Indians skipped the usual road trips to the hills and staycations nearby. Instead, the new-age traveller packed their bags for international getaways.

Video: All 582 rescued from stranded Mumbai monorail after 4 hours amid heavy rainThe monorail services in Mumbai were disrupted between Chembur and Bhakti Park due to a technical snag amid heavy rain. Passengers dialled the civic body helpline number, following which fire officials arrived at the scene and rescued them.

Successful strikes, not Trump: Shashi Tharoor rubbishes US claim on truce with PakSpeaking at the launch of the book Whither India-Pakistan Relations Today? Can They Ever Be Good Neighbours?, Tharoor said it was Pakistan's Director General of Military Operations (DGMO) who reached out to his Indian counterpart after India's Operation Sindoor - not Trump's alleged intervention - that led to the cessation of hostilities.

India-US ties frosty due to Trump comments, MAGA talks of ban on H-1B VisaEven as US President Donald Trump has ratcheted up his tariff talk against India, his MAGA base is drumming up for one more step to hit India — modify or ban H-1B Visa so that fewer Indians can get jobs in the US.

Can NEP 2020 make Ayurveda globally relevant through research and innovation?Ayurveda, India's ancient healing system, is gaining renewed global and domestic relevance as health-conscious communities embrace holistic care. With the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 integrating Indigenous Knowledge Systems, Ayurvedic education now stands at a transformative crossroads of tradition and modern science.

Government approves Rs 62,000-crore deal to buy 97 Light Combat Aircraft Mark 1AThe new order will help the Indian Air Force phase out its ageing MiG-21 fleet, which is set to be retired in the coming weeks.

India, China agree to resume direct flights, re-open border tradeIndia and China agree to reopen border trade at three points, resume direct flights, expand the Mount Kailash pilgrimage, and set up new mechanisms to manage border issues.

Sivakarthikeyan's version of the film will hit theatres on September 5.

sports.headline: Watch: Alcaraz shocks Raducanu, internet with daring around-the-net shotDespite their defeat, Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu created one of the most memorable moments of the US Open mixed doubles.. The moment sparked widespread fan admiration and highlighted their unique on-court chemistry.

Asia Cup: Jaiswal's exclusion from Indian squad surprises Madan LalYoung India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad has surprised former cricketer Madan Lal. Jaiswal was snubbed for Shubman Gill in India's 15-member squad, announced on Tuesday, August 19.

Alexander Isak vs Newcastle United: Premier League transfer stand-off explainedAlexander Isak's standoff with Newcastle United escalated dramatically on Tuesday night, as the Sweden striker publicly accused the club of breaking promises and betraying his trust. Newcastle said in a statement that no commitment was made by a club official that Isak could leave this summer.

Don't want anyone's sympathy: Prithvi Shaw on fresh start in Buchi BabuPrithvi Shaw has dismissed any need for sympathy as he looks to restart his cricketing journey. Shaw has backed himself to return stronger with consistent domestic performances and a renewed sense of determination after his Buchi Babu century.

Asia Cup 2025: Shreyas Iyer knocks hard, but T20I doors stay shutShreyas Iyer continues to find himself out of T20I contention despite knocking hard on the selectors' doors with his unprecedented IPL and domestic numbers. As chief selector Ajit Agarkar says that there's no place for Iyer in the T20I team for now, the question remains: what more does he have to do to get back into the reckoning?

India have picked a fantastic squad for the Asia Cup: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar praised India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, lauding its depth in batting and bowling versatility. He also backed Shubman Gill's vice-captaincy, calling it a sign of India grooming their next leader.

Sunil Gavaskar on India vs Pakistan at Asia Cup: Players will go by government decisionSunil Gavaskar believes that the players should not be criticised for their participation at the Asia Cup and highlights that they are only following the directives of the BCCI which are given the green light by the Indian government.

Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy: Mohammad KaifFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Mohammad Kaif has said that Axar Patel deserves an explanation from the team management for his removal from the vice captaincy of the T20I side.

Can't exclude player in that form: Gavaskar backs Gill as Asia Cup vice-captainSunil Gavaskar has backed Shubman Gill's appointment as India's Asia Cup vice-captain, calling it a step towards his future captaincy. Gavaskar praised Gill's form, leadership skills, and temperament, stressing his inevitable rise as an all-format leader.

Jannik Sinner pulls out of inaugural US Open mixed doubles competitionWorld No 1 Jannik Sinner has withdrawn from the US Open mixed doubles event due to illness. The Italian star had retired from his final against Carlos Alcaraz in Cincinnati Masters on Monday, August 18.

Wasim Akram accused of promoting online gambling app: ReportsFormer Pakistan captain Wasim Akram faces a legal complaint in Lahore for allegedly endorsing a foreign online betting app, with authorities confirming an investigation under the Electronic Crimes Act 2016 after social media evidence surfaced.

Sunil Gavaskar on India vs Pakistan at Asia Cup: Players will go by government decisionSunil Gavaskar believes that the players should not be criticised for their participation at the Asia Cup and highlights that they are only following the directives of the BCCI which are given the green light by the Indian government.

Gavaskar praised Gill's form, leadership skills, and temperament, stressing his inevitable rise as an all-format leader.

Jannik Sinner pulls out of inaugural US Open mixed doubles competitionWorld No 1 Jannik Sinner has withdrawn from the US Open mixed doubles event due to illness. The Italian star had retired from his final against Carlos Alcaraz in Cincinnati Masters on Monday, August 18.

Wasim Akram accused of promoting online gambling app: ReportsFormer Pakistan captain Wasim Akram faces a legal complaint in Lahore for allegedly endorsing a foreign online betting app, with authorities confirming an investigation under the Electronic Crimes Act 2016 after social media evidence surfaced.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
